title: Singapore's Oxley takes over WA builder Pindan Group
text:
Western Australian builder Pindan Group has been taken over by its majority shareholder Singapore-listed developer Oxley Holdings after it failed to meet its performance targets.

Prior to the takeover on Monday, Oxley already owned 40 per cent of the company acquired in 2016. In a notice to the Singapore Exchange, Oxley says it has taken over the company for "nil consideration" in settlement of a claim relating to Pindan following its failure to meet targets.

Pindan's Graceview apartments in Sydney's north shore. Supplied

Pindan, which ran into cashflow problems in 2018 after falling behind on its payments to subcontractors and other creditors and after its part-sale to Oxley, also had to buy back capital to relinquish a $24.3 million debt owed to the company.

The company has replaced its senior management team and will become a subsidiary of the Oxley group.

Pindan's co-founders, managing director George Allingame and director David Pringle, have both left the business.
